trans-unit.source: The 'SIGCONT' event is emitted when a Node.js process previously moved into the background using
The 'SIGCONT' event is emitted when a Node.js process previously moved into the background using <ctrl>-Z (i.e. SIGTSTP) is then brought back to the foreground using fg(1p).
trans-unit.target: El evento 'SIGCONT' se emite cuando un proceso Node.js que se movió previamente a un segundo plano usando <ctrl>-Z (es decir, SIGTSTP ) se devuelve al primer plano usando fg(1p) .

trans-unit.source: The 'SIGINT' event is emitted whenever the input stream receives a

The 'SIGINT' event is emitted whenever the input stream receives a <ctrl>-C input, known typically as SIGINT. If there are no 'SIGINT' event listeners registered when the input stream receives a SIGINT, the 'pause' event will be emitted.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'SIGINT' se emite siempre que el flujo de input recibe una entrada <ctrl>-C , conocida típicamente como SIGINT . Si no hay oyentes de eventos 'SIGINT' registrados cuando el flujo de input recibe un SIGINT , se emitirá el evento 'pause' .

trans-unit.source: The 'SIGTSTP' event is not supported on Windows.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'SIGTSTP' no es compatible con Windows.

trans-unit.source: The 'SIGTSTP' event is emitted when the input stream receives a

The 'SIGTSTP' event is emitted when the input stream receives a <ctrl>-Z input, typically known as SIGTSTP. If there are no 'SIGTSTP' event listeners registered when the input stream receives a SIGTSTP, the Node.js process will be sent to the background.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'SIGTSTP' se emite cuando el flujo de input recibe una entrada <ctrl>-Z , normalmente conocida como SIGTSTP . Si no hay detectores de eventos 'SIGTSTP' registrados cuando el flujo de input recibe un SIGTSTP , el proceso Node.js se enviará a un segundo plano.

trans-unit.source: The 'abort' event is emitted when the abortController.abort() method is called. The callback is invoked with a single object argument with a single type propety set to 'abort':
The 'aborted' event is emitted whenever a Http2ServerRequest instance is abnormally aborted in mid-communication.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'aborted' se emite siempre que una instancia de Http2ServerRequest se aborta de manera anormal en medio de la comunicación.

trans-unit.source: The 'aborted' event is emitted whenever a Http2Stream instance is abnormally aborted in mid-communication.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'aborted' se emite siempre que una instancia de Http2Stream se aborta de forma anormal en medio de la comunicación.

trans-unit.source: The 'aborted' event is emitted whenever a Http2Stream instance is abnormally aborted in mid-communication. Its listener does not expect any arguments.
The 'aborted' event will only be emitted if the Http2ServerRequest writable side has not been ended.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'aborted' solo se emitirá si el lado de escritura de Http2ServerRequest no ha finalizado.

trans-unit.source: The 'aborted' event will only be emitted if the Http2Stream writable side has not been ended.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'aborted' solo se emitirá si el lado de escritura de Http2Stream no ha finalizado.

trans-unit.source: The 'altsvc' event is emitted whenever an ALTSVC frame is received by the client. The event is emitted with the ALTSVC value, origin, and stream ID. If no origin is provided in the ALTSVC frame, origin will be an empty string.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'altsvc' se emite siempre que el cliente recibe una trama ALTSVC . El evento se emite con el valor ALTSVC , el origen y el ID de flujo. Si no se proporciona un origin en la trama ALTSVC , el origin será una cadena vacía.

trans-unit.source: The 'beforeExit' event is not emitted for conditions causing explicit termination, such as calling process.exit() or uncaught exceptions.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'beforeExit' no se emite para condiciones que causan una terminación explícita, como llamar a process.exit() o excepciones no detectadas.

trans-unit.source: The 'beforeExit' event is emitted when Node.js empties its event loop and has no additional work to schedule. Normally, the Node.js process will exit when there is no work scheduled, but a listener registered on the 'beforeExit' event can make asynchronous calls, and thereby cause the Node.js process to continue.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'beforeExit' se emite cuando Node.js vacía su ciclo de eventos y no tiene trabajo adicional que programar. Normalmente, el proceso Node.js se cerrará cuando no haya trabajo programado, pero un oyente registrado en el evento 'beforeExit' puede realizar llamadas asíncronas y, por lo tanto, hacer que el proceso Node.js continúe.

trans-unit.source: The 'beforeExit' should not be used as an alternative to the 'exit' event unless the intention is to schedule additional work.
trans-unit.target: El 'beforeExit' debe no ser utilizado como una alternativa a la 'exit' caso a menos que la intención es la de programar el trabajo adicional.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted after a socket is closed with close(). Once triggered, no new 'message' events will be emitted on this socket.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite después de cerrar un socket con close() . Una vez activado, no se emitirán nuevos eventos de 'message' en este conector.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted once either side of the channel has been disconnected.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite una vez que se ha desconectado cualquier lado del canal.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted once the Http2Session has been destroyed. Its listener does not expect any arguments.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite una vez que se ha destruido Http2Session . Su oyente no espera ningún argumento.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted when one of the following occur:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite cuando ocurre una de las siguientes situaciones:

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted when the FileHandle and any of its underlying resources (a file descriptor, for example) have been closed.
The 'close' event is emitted when the Http2Stream is destroyed. Once this event is emitted, the Http2Stream instance is no longer usable.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite cuando se destruye Http2Stream . Una vez que se emite este evento, la instancia de Http2Stream ya no se puede utilizar.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted when the stdio streams of a child process have been closed. This is distinct from the 'exit' event, since multiple processes might share the same stdio streams.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite cuando se cierran los flujos stdio de un proceso hijo. Esto es distinto del evento 'exit' , ya que varios procesos pueden compartir los mismos flujos stdio.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event is emitted when the stream and any of its underlying resources (a file descriptor, for example) have been closed. The event indicates that no more events will be emitted, and no further computation will occur.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'close' se emite cuando la secuencia y cualquiera de sus recursos subyacentes (un descriptor de archivo, por ejemplo) se han cerrado. El evento indica que no se emitirán más eventos y no se producirán más cálculos.

trans-unit.source: The 'close' event will not be emitted more than once.
The 'close' event will only ever be emitted once.
The 'connect' event is emitted after a socket is associated to a remote address as a result of a successful connect() call.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'connect' se emite después de que un socket se asocia a una dirección remota como resultado de una llamada connect() exitosa .

trans-unit.source: The 'connect' event is emitted once the Http2Session has been successfully connected to the remote peer and communication may begin.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'connect' se emite una vez que Http2Session se ha conectado correctamente al par remoto y puede comenzar la comunicación.

trans-unit.source: The 'data' event is emitted whenever the stream is relinquishing ownership of a chunk of data to a consumer. This may occur whenever the stream is switched in flowing mode by calling readable.pipe(), readable.resume(), or by attaching a listener callback to the 'data' event. The 'data' event will also be emitted whenever the readable.read() method is called and a chunk of data is available to be returned.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'data' se emite siempre que la transmisión cede la propiedad de una parte de los datos a un consumidor. Esto puede ocurrir siempre que el flujo se cambie en modo de flujo llamando a readable.pipe() , readable.resume() o adjuntando una devolución de llamada de escucha al evento 'data' . El evento 'data' también se emitirá siempre que se llame al método readable.read() y haya una parte de los datos disponible para devolver.

trans-unit.source: The 'disconnect' event is emitted after calling the subprocess.disconnect() method in parent process or process.disconnect() in child process. After disconnecting it is no longer possible to send or receive messages, and the subprocess.connected property is false.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'disconnect' se emite después de llamar al método subprocess.disconnect() en el proceso padre o process.disconnect() en el proceso hijo. Después de desconectarse, ya no es posible enviar o recibir mensajes, y la propiedad subprocess.connected es false .

trans-unit.source: The 'disconnect' event will be emitted when there are no messages in the process of being received. This will most often be triggered immediately after calling subprocess.disconnect().
trans-unit.target: El evento 'disconnect' se emitirá cuando no haya mensajes en proceso de recepción. Esto a menudo se activará inmediatamente después de llamar a subprocess.disconnect() .

trans-unit.source: The 'end' event will not be emitted unless the data is completely consumed. This can be accomplished by switching the stream into flowing mode, or by calling stream.read() repeatedly until all data has been consumed.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'end' no se emitirá a menos que los datos se consuman por completo. Esto se puede lograr cambiando la secuencia a modo de flujo o llamando a stream.read() repetidamente hasta que se hayan consumido todos los datos.

trans-unit.source: The 'end' event is emitted when there is no more data to be consumed from the stream.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'end' se emite cuando no hay más datos para consumir de la transmisión.

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event is emitted if an error occurred while writing or piping data. The listener callback is passed a single Error argument when called.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' se emite si se produce un error al escribir o canalizar datos. A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasa un único argumento Error cuando se llama.

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event is emitted if the worker thread throws an uncaught exception. In that case, the worker is terminated.
The 'error' event is emitted if the worker thread throws an uncaught exception. In that case, the worker will be terminated.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' se emite si el hilo de trabajo lanza una excepción no detectada. En ese caso, el trabajador será despedido.

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event is emitted when an error occurs during the processing of an Http2Session.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' se emite cuando ocurre un error durante el procesamiento de una Http2Session .

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event is emitted when an error occurs during the processing of an Http2Stream.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' se emite cuando ocurre un error durante el procesamiento de un Http2Stream .

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event is emitted whenever any error occurs. The event handler function is passed a single Error object.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' se emite siempre que ocurre algún error. A la función del controlador de eventos se le pasa un único objeto Error .

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event is emitted whenever:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' se emite siempre que:

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event may be emitted by a Readable implementation at any time. Typically, this may occur if the underlying stream is unable to generate data due to an underlying internal failure, or when a stream implementation attempts to push an invalid chunk of data.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'error' puede ser emitido por una implementación Readable en cualquier momento. Por lo general, esto puede ocurrir si la transmisión subyacente no puede generar datos debido a una falla interna subyacente o cuando una implementación de transmisión intenta enviar un fragmento de datos no válido.

trans-unit.source: The 'error' event will not be emitted more than once.
The 'error' event will only ever be emitted once.

The 'error' events that are generated by the captureRejections behavior do not have a catch handler to avoid infinite error loops: the recommendation is to not use async functions as 'error' event handlers.

The 'exit' event is emitted after the child process ends. If the process exited, code is the final exit code of the process, otherwise null. If the process terminated due to receipt of a signal, signal is the string name of the signal, otherwise null. One of the two will always be non-null.

The 'exit' event is emitted after the child process ends. If the process exited, code is the final exit code of the process, otherwise null. If the process terminated due to receipt of a signal, signal is the string name of the signal, otherwise null. One of the two will always be non-null.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'exit' se emite después de que finaliza el proceso hijo. Si el proceso salió, el code es el código de salida final del proceso; de lo contrario, es null . Si el proceso terminó debido a la recepción de una señal, la signal es el nombre de la cadena de la señal, de lo contrario null . Uno de los dos siempre será no nulo.

trans-unit.source: The 'exit' event is emitted once the worker has stopped. If the worker exited by calling process.exit(), the exitCode parameter is the passed exit code. If the worker was terminated, the exitCode parameter is 1.

The 'exit' event is emitted once the worker has stopped. If the worker exited by calling process.exit(), the exitCode parameter will be the passed exit code. If the worker was terminated, the exitCode parameter will be 1.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'exit' se emite una vez que el trabajador se ha detenido. Si el trabajador salió llamando a process.exit() , el parámetro exitCode será el código de salida pasado. Si el trabajador fue despedido, el parámetro exitCode será 1 .

trans-unit.source: The 'exit' event is emitted when the Node.js process is about to exit as a result of either:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'exit' se emite cuando el proceso de Node.js está a punto de salir como resultado de:

trans-unit.source: The 'exit' event is emitted when the REPL is exited either by receiving the .exit command as input, the user pressing

The 'exit' event is emitted when the REPL is exited either by receiving the .exit command as input, the user pressing <ctrl>-C twice to signal SIGINT, or by pressing <ctrl>-D to signal 'end' on the input stream. The listener callback is invoked without any arguments.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'exit' se emite cuando se sale del REPL ya sea recibiendo el comando .exit como entrada, el usuario presionando <ctrl>-C dos veces para señalar SIGINT , o presionando <ctrl>-D para señalar 'end' en el flujo de entrada. La devolución de llamada del oyente se invoca sin ningún argumento.

trans-unit.source: The 'exit' event may or may not fire after an error has occurred. When listening to both the 'exit' and 'error' events, guard against accidentally invoking handler functions multiple times.

The 'exit' event may or may not fire after an error has occurred. When listening to both the 'exit' and 'error' events, it is important to guard against accidentally invoking handler functions multiple times.
trans-unit.target: El evento de 'exit' puede o no activarse después de que haya ocurrido un error. Al escuchar 'error' eventos de 'exit' y 'error' , es importante evitar la invocación accidental de funciones de controlador varias veces.

trans-unit.source: The 'finish' event is emitted after the stream.end() method has been called, and all data has been flushed to the underlying system.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'finish' se emite después de que se haya llamado al método stream.end() y todos los datos se hayan descargado al sistema subyacente.

trans-unit.source: The 'frameError' event is emitted when an error occurs while attempting to send a frame on the session. If the frame that could not be sent is associated with a specific Http2Stream, an attempt to emit a 'frameError' event on the Http2Stream is made.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'frameError' se emite cuando se produce un error al intentar enviar un marco en la sesión. Si la trama que no se pudo enviar está asociada con un Http2Stream específico , se realiza un intento de emitir un evento 'frameError' en Http2Stream .

trans-unit.source: The 'frameError' event is emitted when an error occurs while attempting to send a frame. When invoked, the handler function will receive an integer argument identifying the frame type, and an integer argument identifying the error code. The Http2Stream instance will be destroyed immediately after the 'frameError' event is emitted.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'frameError' se emite cuando se produce un error al intentar enviar una trama. Cuando se invoca, la función de controlador recibirá un argumento entero que identifica el tipo de trama y un argumento entero que identifica el código de error. La instancia de Http2Stream se destruirá inmediatamente después 'frameError' evento 'frameError' .

trans-unit.source: The 'goaway' event is emitted when a GOAWAY frame is received.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'goaway' se emite cuando se GOAWAY una trama GOAWAY .

trans-unit.source: The 'headers' event is emitted when an additional block of headers is received for a stream, such as when a block of 1xx informational headers is received. The listener callback is passed the HTTP/2 Headers Object and flags associated with the headers.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'headers' se emite cuando se recibe un bloque adicional de encabezados para un flujo, como cuando se recibe un bloque de encabezados informativos 1xx . A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasa el objeto de encabezados HTTP / 2 y los indicadores asociados con los encabezados.

trans-unit.source: The 'iso-8859-16' encoding listed in the WHATWG Encoding Standard is not supported.
trans-unit.target: La codificación 'iso-8859-16' enumerada en el estándar de codificación WHATWG no es compatible.

trans-unit.source: The 'keylog' event will be emitted multiple times.
The 'line' event is emitted whenever the input stream receives an end-of-line input (\n, \r, or \r\n). This usually occurs when the user presses
The 'line' event is emitted whenever the input stream receives an end-of-line input (\n, \r, or \r\n). This usually occurs when the user presses the <Enter>, or <Return> keys.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'line' se emite siempre que el flujo de input recibe una entrada de fin de línea ( \n , \r o \r\n ). Esto suele ocurrir cuando el usuario presiona las teclas <Enter> o <Return> .

trans-unit.source: The 'listening' event is emitted once the dgram.Socket is addressable and can receive data. This happens either explicitly with socket.bind() or implicitly the first time data is sent using socket.send(). Until the dgram.Socket is listening, the underlying system resources do not exist and calls such as socket.address() and socket.setTTL() will fail.
The 'listening' event is emitted whenever a socket begins listening for datagram messages. This occurs as soon as UDP sockets are created.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'listening' se emite cada vez que un conector comienza a escuchar mensajes de datagramas. Esto ocurre tan pronto como se crean los sockets UDP.

trans-unit.source: The 'listening' event will only ever be emitted once.
The 'localSettings' event is emitted when an acknowledgment SETTINGS frame has been received.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'localSettings' se emite cuando se ha recibido una trama SETTINGS de reconocimiento .

trans-unit.source: The 'message' event is emitted for any incoming message, containing the cloned input of port.postMessage().
trans-unit.target: El evento 'message' se emite para cualquier mensaje entrante, que contiene la entrada clonada de port.postMessage() .

trans-unit.source: The 'message' event is emitted when a new datagram is available on a socket. The event handler function is passed two arguments: msg and rinfo.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'message' se emite cuando un nuevo datagrama está disponible en un socket. A la función del controlador de eventos se le pasan dos argumentos: msg y rinfo .

trans-unit.source: The 'message' event is emitted when the worker thread has invoked require('worker_threads').parentPort.postMessage(). See the port.on('message') event for more details.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'message' se emite cuando el hilo de trabajo ha invocado require('worker_threads').parentPort.postMessage() . Consulte el port.on('message') para obtener más detalles.

trans-unit.source: The 'message' event is triggered when a child process uses process.send() to send messages.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'message' se activa cuando un proceso hijo usa process.send() para enviar mensajes.

trans-unit.source: The 'messageerror' event is emitted when deserializing a message failed.
The 'multipleResolves' event is emitted whenever a Promise has been either:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'multipleResolves' se emite siempre que una Promise ha sido:

trans-unit.source: The 'newSession' event is emitted upon creation of a new TLS session. This may be used to store sessions in external storage. The data should be provided to the 'resumeSession' callback.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'newSession' se emite cuando se crea una nueva sesión TLS. Esto puede usarse para almacenar sesiones en almacenamiento externo. Los datos deben proporcionarse a la devolución 'resumeSession' llamada 'resumeSession' .

trans-unit.source: The 'online' event is emitted when the worker thread has started executing JavaScript code.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'online' se emite cuando el hilo de trabajo ha comenzado a ejecutar código JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: The 'origin' event is emitted whenever an ORIGIN frame is received by the client. The event is emitted with an array of origin strings. The http2session.originSet will be updated to include the received origins.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'origin' se emite siempre que el cliente recibe una trama ORIGIN . El evento se emite con una matriz de cadenas de origin . El http2session.originSet se actualizará para incluir los orígenes recibidos.

trans-unit.source: The 'origin' event is only emitted when using a secure TLS connection.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'origin' solo se emite cuando se usa una conexión TLS segura.

trans-unit.source: The 'pathValidation' event will be emitted multiple times.
The 'pause' and 'SIGCONT' events will not be emitted if the input was paused before the process was sent to the background.
trans-unit.target: Los eventos 'pause' y 'SIGCONT' no se emitirán si la input se pausó antes de que el proceso se enviara a un segundo plano.

trans-unit.source: The 'pause' event is emitted when stream.pause() is called and readableFlowing is not false.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'pause' se emite cuando se llama a stream.pause() y readableFlowing no es false .

trans-unit.source: The 'pause' event is emitted when one of the following occur:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'pause' se emite cuando ocurre una de las siguientes situaciones:

trans-unit.source: The 'ping' event is emitted whenever a PING frame is received from the connected peer.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'ping' se emite siempre que se recibe una trama PING del par conectado.

trans-unit.source: The 'pipe' event is emitted when the stream.pipe() method is called on a readable stream, adding this writable to its set of destinations.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'pipe' se emite cuando se llama al método stream.pipe() en un flujo legible, agregando este modificable a su conjunto de destinos.

trans-unit.source: The 'push' event is emitted when response headers for a Server Push stream are received. The listener callback is passed the HTTP/2 Headers Object and flags associated with the headers.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'push' se emite cuando se reciben los encabezados de respuesta para un flujo de Server Push. A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasa el objeto de encabezados HTTP / 2 y los indicadores asociados con los encabezados.

trans-unit.source: The 'qlog' event is emitted when the QuicClientSession is ready to begin providing qlog event data. The callback is invoked with a single argument:

The 'readable' event is emitted when there is data available to be read from the stream. In some cases, attaching a listener for the 'readable' event will cause some amount of data to be read into an internal buffer.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'readable' se emite cuando hay datos disponibles para leer de la transmisión. En algunos casos, adjuntar un oyente para el evento 'readable' hará que una cierta cantidad de datos se lea en un búfer interno.

trans-unit.source: The 'readable' event will also be emitted once the end of the stream data has been reached but before the 'end' event is emitted.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'readable' también se emitirá una vez que se haya alcanzado el final de la transmisión de datos, pero antes de que se emita el evento 'end' .

trans-unit.source: The 'readable' is always emitted in the next tick after .push() is called.
trans-unit.target: El 'readable' siempre se emite en el siguiente tick después de que se llama a .push() .

trans-unit.source: The 'ready' event is emitted when the Http2Stream has been opened, has been assigned an id, and can be used. The listener does not expect any arguments.
The 'ready' event will only ever be emitted once.

The 'rejectionHandled' event is emitted whenever a Promise has been rejected and an error handler was attached to it (using promise.catch(), for example) later than one turn of the Node.js event loop.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'rejectionHandled' se emite cada vez que se rechaza una Promise y se le adjunta un controlador de errores (usando promise.catch() , por ejemplo) después de un turno del bucle de eventos Node.js.

trans-unit.source: The 'remoteSettings' event is emitted when a new SETTINGS frame is received from the connected peer.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'remoteSettings' se emite cuando se recibe una nueva trama SETTINGS del par conectado.

trans-unit.source: The 'removeListener' event is emitted after the listener is removed.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'removeListener' se emite después de listener se elimina el oyente .

trans-unit.source: The 'request' event works identically on both HTTPS and HTTP/2.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'request' funciona de manera idéntica tanto en HTTPS como en HTTP / 2.

trans-unit.source: The 'reset' event is emitted when the REPL's context is reset. This occurs whenever the .clear command is received as input unless the REPL is using the default evaluator and the repl.REPLServer instance was created with the useGlobal option set to true. The listener callback will be called with a reference to the context object as the only argument.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'reset' se emite cuando se reinicia el contexto de REPL. Esto ocurre siempre que el comando .clear se recibe como entrada, a menos que REPL esté usando el evaluador predeterminado y la instancia repl.REPLServer se haya creado con la opción useGlobal establecida en true . Se llamará a la devolución de llamada del oyente con una referencia al objeto de context o como único argumento.

trans-unit.source: The 'resize' event is emitted whenever either of the writeStream.columns or writeStream.rows properties have changed. No arguments are passed to the listener callback when called.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'resize' writeStream.columns ' se emite cada vez que las propiedades writeStream.columns o writeStream.rows han cambiado. No se pasan argumentos a la devolución de llamada del oyente cuando se llama.

trans-unit.source: The 'response' event is emitted when a response HEADERS frame has been received for this stream from the connected HTTP/2 server. The listener is invoked with two arguments: an Object containing the received HTTP/2 Headers Object, and flags associated with the headers.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'response' se emite cuando se recibe una trama HEADERS de respuesta para esta secuencia desde el servidor HTTP / 2 conectado. El oyente se invoca con dos argumentos: un Object contiene el objeto de encabezados HTTP / 2 recibido y los indicadores asociados con los encabezados.

trans-unit.source: The 'resume' event is emitted when stream.resume() is called and readableFlowing is not true.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'resume' se emite cuando se llama a stream.resume() y readableFlowing no es true .

trans-unit.source: The 'resume' event is emitted whenever the input stream is resumed.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'resume' se emite siempre que se reanuda el flujo de input .

trans-unit.source: The 'resumeSession' event is emitted when the client requests to resume a previous TLS session. The listener callback is passed two arguments when called:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'resumeSession' se emite cuando el cliente solicita reanudar una sesión TLS anterior. A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasan dos argumentos cuando se llama:

trans-unit.source: The 'secure' event is emitted by the SecurePair object once a secure connection has been established.
trans-unit.target: El objeto SecurePair emite el evento 'secure' una vez que se ha establecido una conexión segura.

trans-unit.source: The 'secure' event will not be emitted more than once.

The 'secureConnect' event is emitted after the handshaking process for a new connection has successfully completed. The listener callback will be called regardless of whether or not the server's certificate has been authorized. It is the client's responsibility to check the tlsSocket.authorized property to determine if the server certificate was signed by one of the specified CAs. If tlsSocket.authorized === false, then the error can be found by examining the tlsSocket.authorizationError property. If ALPN was used, the tlsSocket.alpnProtocol property can be checked to determine the negotiated protocol.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'secureConnect' se emite después de que el proceso de negociación para una nueva conexión se haya completado con éxito. Se llamará a la devolución de llamada del oyente independientemente de si se ha autorizado o no el certificado del servidor. Es responsabilidad del cliente verificar la propiedad tlsSocket.authorized para determinar si el certificado del servidor fue firmado por una de las CA especificadas. Si tlsSocket.authorized === false , el error se puede encontrar examinando la propiedad tlsSocket.authorizationError . Si se utilizó tlsSocket.alpnProtocol , se puede comprobar la propiedad tlsSocket.alpnProtocol para determinar el protocolo negociado.

trans-unit.source: The 'secureConnection' event is emitted after the handshaking process for a new connection has successfully completed. The listener callback is passed a single argument when called:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'secureConnection' se emite después de que el proceso de negociación para una nueva conexión se haya completado con éxito. A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasa un único argumento cuando se llama:

trans-unit.source: The 'session' event handler can be an async function.

The 'session' event is emitted on a client tls.TLSSocket when a new session or TLS ticket is available. This may or may not be before the handshake is complete, depending on the TLS protocol version that was negotiated. The event is not emitted on the server, or if a new session was not created, for example, when the connection was resumed. For some TLS protocol versions the event may be emitted multiple times, in which case all the sessions can be used for resumption.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'session' se emite en un cliente tls.TLSSocket cuando hay una nueva sesión o un ticket TLS disponible. Esto puede ocurrir o no antes de que se complete el protocolo de enlace, según la versión del protocolo TLS que se negoció. El evento no se emite en el servidor, o si no se creó una nueva sesión, por ejemplo, cuando se reanudó la conexión. Para algunas versiones del protocolo TLS, el evento puede emitirse varias veces, en cuyo caso todas las sesiones se pueden utilizar para la reanudación.

trans-unit.source: The 'session' event is emitted when a new Http2Session is created by the Http2SecureServer.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'session' se emite cuando Http2Session crea una nueva Http2SecureServer .

trans-unit.source: The 'session' event is emitted when a new Http2Session is created by the Http2Server.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'session' se emite cuando el Http2Session crea una nueva Http2Server .

trans-unit.source: The 'session' event will be emitted multiple times.
The 'sessionError' event is emitted when an 'error' event is emitted by an Http2Session object associated with the Http2SecureServer.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'sessionError' se emite cuando un objeto Http2Session asociado con Http2SecureServer emite un evento 'error' .

trans-unit.source: The 'sessionError' event is emitted when an 'error' event is emitted by an Http2Session object associated with the Http2Server.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'sessionError' se emite cuando un objeto Http2Session asociado con el Http2Server emite un evento 'error' .

trans-unit.source: The 'sessionTicket' event is emitted when a new TLS session ticket has been generated for the current QuicClientSession. The callback is invoked with two arguments:
The 'sessionTicket' event may be emitted multiple times.
The 'spawn' event is emitted once the child process has spawned successfully.

The 'spawn' event will fire regardless of whether an error occurs within the spawned process. For example, if bash some-command spawns successfully, the 'spawn' event will fire, though bash may fail to spawn some-command. This caveat also applies when using { shell: true }.
The 'stream' event is emitted by the QuicSession when a new QuicStream has been initiated by the connected peer:
The 'stream' event is emitted when a 'stream' event has been emitted by an Http2Session associated with the server.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'stream' se emite cuando un evento Http2Session asociado con el servidor ha emitido un evento 'stream' .

trans-unit.source: The 'stream' event is emitted when a new Http2Stream is created.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'stream' se emite cuando se crea un nuevo Http2Stream .

trans-unit.source: The 'stream' event may be emitted multiple times.
The 'timeout' event is emitted after no activity is received for this Http2Stream within the number of milliseconds set using http2stream.setTimeout().
trans-unit.target: El evento 'timeout' se emite después de que no se recibe actividad para este Http2Stream dentro del número de milisegundos establecido usando http2stream.setTimeout() .

trans-unit.source: The 'timeout' event is emitted after no activity is received for this Http2Stream within the number of milliseconds set using http2stream.setTimeout(). Its listener does not expect any arguments.
The 'timeout' event is emitted when there is no activity on the Server for a given number of milliseconds set using http2secureServer.setTimeout(). Default: 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'timeout' se emite cuando no hay actividad en el servidor durante un número determinado de milisegundos establecido mediante http2secureServer.setTimeout() . Predeterminado: 2 minutos.

trans-unit.source: The 'timeout' event is emitted when there is no activity on the Server for a given number of milliseconds set using http2server.setTimeout().
trans-unit.target: El evento 'timeout' se emite cuando no hay actividad en el servidor durante un número determinado de milisegundos establecido mediante http2server.setTimeout() .

trans-unit.source: The 'timeout' event is emitted when there is no activity on the Server for a given number of milliseconds set using http2server.setTimeout(). Default: 0 (no timeout)
The 'timeout' event is emitted when there is no activity on the Server for a given number of milliseconds set using http2server.setTimeout(). Default: 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'timeout' se emite cuando no hay actividad en el servidor durante un número determinado de milisegundos establecido mediante http2server.setTimeout() . Predeterminado: 2 minutos.

trans-unit.source: The 'tlsClientError' event is emitted when an error occurs before a secure connection is established. The listener callback is passed two arguments when called:
trans-unit.target: El evento 'tlsClientError' se emite cuando ocurre un error antes de que se establezca una conexión segura. A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasan dos argumentos cuando se llama:

trans-unit.source: The 'trailers' event is emitted when a block of headers associated with trailing header fields is received. The listener callback is passed the HTTP/2 Headers Object and flags associated with the headers.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'trailers' se emite cuando se recibe un bloque de encabezados asociados con campos de encabezado finales. A la devolución de llamada del oyente se le pasa el objeto de encabezados HTTP / 2 y los indicadores asociados con los encabezados.

trans-unit.source: The 'uncaughtException' event is emitted when an uncaught JavaScript exception bubbles all the way back to the event loop. By default, Node.js handles such exceptions by printing the stack trace to stderr and exiting with code 1, overriding any previously set process.exitCode. Adding a handler for the 'uncaughtException' event overrides this default behavior. Alternatively, change the process.exitCode in the 'uncaughtException' handler which will result in the process exiting with the provided exit code. Otherwise, in the presence of such handler the process will exit with 0.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'uncaughtException' se emite cuando una excepción de JavaScript no detectada burbujea hasta el ciclo de eventos. De forma predeterminada, Node.js maneja tales excepciones imprimiendo el seguimiento de la pila en stderr y saliendo con el código 1, anulando cualquier process.exitCode previamente establecido . Agregar un controlador para el evento 'uncaughtException' anula este comportamiento predeterminado. Alternativamente, cambie el process.exitCode en el controlador 'uncaughtException' que resultará en que el proceso salga con el código de salida proporcionado. De lo contrario, en presencia de dicho controlador, el proceso saldrá con 0.

trans-unit.source: The 'uncaughtException' event is from now on triggered if the repl is used as standalone program.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'uncaughtException' se activa a partir de ahora si la respuesta se utiliza como programa independiente.

trans-unit.source: The 'uncaughtExceptionMonitor' event is emitted before an 'uncaughtException' event is emitted or a hook installed via process.setUncaughtExceptionCaptureCallback() is called.

The 'unhandledRejection' event is emitted whenever a Promise is rejected and no error handler is attached to the promise within a turn of the event loop. When programming with Promises, exceptions are encapsulated as "rejected promises". Rejections can be caught and handled using promise.catch() and are propagated through a Promise chain. The 'unhandledRejection' event is useful for detecting and keeping track of promises that were rejected whose rejections have not yet been handled.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'unhandledRejection' se emite siempre que se rechaza una Promise y no se adjunta ningún controlador de errores a la promesa dentro de un turno del bucle de eventos. Al programar con Promesas, las excepciones se encapsulan como "promesas rechazadas". Los rechazos pueden detectarse y manejarse usando promise.catch() y se propagan a través de una cadena Promise . El evento 'unhandledRejection' es útil para detectar y realizar un seguimiento de las promesas rechazadas cuyos rechazos aún no se han manejado.

trans-unit.source: The 'unknownProtocol' event is emitted when a connecting client fails to negotiate an allowed protocol (i.e. HTTP/2 or HTTP/1.1). The event handler receives the socket for handling. If no listener is registered for this event, the connection is terminated. See the Compatibility API.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'unknownProtocol' se emite cuando un cliente que se conecta no puede negociar un protocolo permitido (es decir, HTTP / 2 o HTTP / 1.1). El controlador de eventos recibe el socket para su manejo. Si no se registra ningún oyente para este evento, se termina la conexión. Consulte la API de compatibilidad .

trans-unit.source: The 'unpipe' event is emitted when the stream.unpipe() method is called on a Readable stream, removing this Writable from its set of destinations.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'unpipe' se emite cuando se llama al método stream.unpipe() en un flujo Readable , eliminando este Writable de su conjunto de destinos.

trans-unit.source: The 'usePreferredAddress' event is emitted when the client QuicSession is updated to use the server-advertised preferred address. The callback is invoked with a single address argument:
The 'usePreferredAddress' event will not be emitted more than once.

The 'wantTrailers' event is emitted when the Http2Stream has queued the final DATA frame to be sent on a frame and the Http2Stream is ready to send trailing headers. When initiating a request or response, the waitForTrailers option must be set for this event to be emitted.
trans-unit.target: El evento 'wantTrailers' se emite cuando Http2Stream ha puesto en cola la trama de DATA final que se enviará en una trama y Http2Stream está listo para enviar encabezados finales. Al iniciar una solicitud o respuesta, se debe configurar la opción waitForTrailers para que se emita este evento.

trans-unit.source: The 'warning' event is emitted whenever Node.js emits a process warning.
trans-unit.target: El evento de 'warning' se emite siempre que Node.js emite una advertencia de proceso.

trans-unit.source: The *-deprecation command line flags only affect warnings that use the name 'DeprecationWarning'.
trans-unit.target: Los *-deprecation línea de comando * -deprecation solo afectan a las advertencias que usan el nombre 'DeprecationWarning' .

trans-unit.source: The *-deprecation command-line flags only affect warnings that use the name 'DeprecationWarning'.
The --entry-type=... flag is not compatible with the Node.js REPL.
trans-unit.target: El --entry-type=... no es compatible con el REPL de Node.js.

trans-unit.source: The --entry-type=commonjs flag was used to attempt to execute an .mjs file or a .js file where the nearest parent package.json contains "type": "module"; or the --entry-type=module flag was used to attempt to execute a .cjs file or a .js file where the nearest parent package.json either lacks a "type" field or contains "type": "commonjs".
trans-unit.target: La --entry-type=commonjs se usó para intentar ejecutar un archivo .mjs o un archivo .js donde el package.json principal más cercano.json contiene "type": "module" ; o se --entry-type=module la marca --entry-type = module para intentar ejecutar un archivo .cjs o un archivo .js donde el package.json padre más cercano carece de un campo "type" o contiene "type": "commonjs" .

trans-unit.source: The --es-module-specifier-resolution=[mode] flag can be used to customize the extension resolution algorithm. The default mode is explicit, which requires the full path to a module be provided to the loader. To enable the automatic extension resolution and importing from directories that include an index file use the node mode.
trans-unit.target: El --es-module-specifier-resolution=[mode] se puede utilizar para personalizar el algoritmo de resolución de la extensión. El modo predeterminado es explicit , lo que requiere que se proporcione al cargador la ruta completa a un módulo. Para habilitar la resolución automática de extensiones y la importación desde directorios que incluyen un archivo de índice, use el modo node .

trans-unit.source: The --experimental-json-modules flag is needed for the module to work.
The --experimental-modules flag can be used to enable support for ECMAScript modules (ES modules).
trans-unit.target: La --experimental-modules se puede utilizar para habilitar la compatibilidad con módulos ECMAScript (módulos ES).

trans-unit.source: The --experimental-policy flag can be used to enable features for policies when loading modules.
trans-unit.target: La --experimental-policy se puede utilizar para habilitar funciones para políticas al cargar módulos.

trans-unit.source: The --experimental-specifier-resolution=[mode] flag can be used to customize the extension resolution algorithm. The default mode is explicit, which requires the full path to a module be provided to the loader. To enable the automatic extension resolution and importing from directories that include an index file use the node mode.
The --experimental-wasi-unstable-preview1 CLI argument is needed for this example to run.
The --input-type flag was used to attempt to execute a file. This flag can only be used with input via --eval, --print or STDIN.
trans-unit.target: La --input-type se usó para intentar ejecutar un archivo. Esta bandera solo se puede usar con la entrada a través de --eval , --print o STDIN .

trans-unit.source: The --preserve-symlinks command line flag instructs Node.js to use the symlink path for modules as opposed to the real path, allowing symbolically linked peer dependencies to be found.
trans-unit.target: La --preserve-symlinks línea de comando --preserve-symlinks le indica a Node.js que use la ruta del enlace simbólico para los módulos en lugar de la ruta real, lo que permite encontrar dependencias de pares vinculadas simbólicamente.

trans-unit.source: The --preserve-symlinks command-line flag instructs Node.js to use the symlink path for modules as opposed to the real path, allowing symbolically linked peer dependencies to be found.

The --preserve-symlinks flag does not apply to the main module, which allows node --preserve-symlinks node_module/.bin/<foo> to work. To apply the same behavior for the main module, also use --preserve-symlinks-main.
trans-unit.target: El --preserve-symlinks no se aplica al módulo principal, lo que permite que el node --preserve-symlinks node_module/.bin/<foo> funcione. Para aplicar el mismo comportamiento para el módulo principal, también use --preserve-symlinks-main .

trans-unit.source: The --require option is now supported when checking a file.
trans-unit.target: La opción --require ahora es compatible al verificar un archivo.

trans-unit.source: The --throw-deprecation command line flag and process.throwDeprecation property take precedence over --trace-deprecation and process.traceDeprecation.
trans-unit.target: La --throw-deprecation línea de comando --throw-deprecation y la propiedad process.throwDeprecation tienen prioridad sobre --trace-deprecation y process.traceDeprecation .

trans-unit.source: The --throw-deprecation command-line flag and process.throwDeprecation property take precedence over --trace-deprecation and process.traceDeprecation.
The --trace-warnings command-line option can be used to have the default console output for warnings include the full stack trace of the warning.
trans-unit.target: La opción de línea de comandos --trace-warnings se puede utilizar para que la salida predeterminada de la consola para las advertencias incluya el seguimiento de la pila completa de la advertencia.

trans-unit.source: The --with-lttng compile-time option has been removed.
trans-unit.target: La opción --with-lttng compile-time ha sido eliminada.

trans-unit.source: The --zero-fill-buffers command line option
trans-unit.target: La opción de línea de comando --zero-fill-buffers

trans-unit.source: The --zero-fill-buffers command-line option
The -0 and +0 are not considered equal anymore.
trans-unit.target: El -0 y +0 ya no se consideran iguales.

trans-unit.source: The .mjs and .cjs extensions can be used to mix types within the same package:
The .mjs and .cjs extensions may be used to mix types within the same package scope:
trans-unit.target: Las .mjs y .cjs pueden usarse para mezclar tipos dentro del mismo alcance del paquete:

trans-unit.source: The :method and :path pseudo-headers are not specified within headers, they respectively default to:
trans-unit.target: Los pseudo-encabezados :method y :path no se especifican dentro de los headers , respectivamente, por defecto:

trans-unit.source: The :status header is converted to number.
trans-unit.target: El encabezado :status se convierte en number .

trans-unit.source: The AES-CTR method uses the rightmost length bits of the block as the counter and the remaining bits as the nonce.
The ALPNProtocols option can be a TypedArray or DataView now.
trans-unit.target: La opción ALPNProtocols ahora puede ser TypedArray o DataView .

trans-unit.source: The AbortController with which the AbortSignal is associated will only ever trigger the 'abort' event once. Any event listeners attached to the AbortSignalshould use the { once: true } option (or, if using the EventEmitter APIs to attach a listener, use the once() method) to ensure that the event listener is removed as soon as the 'abort' event is handled. Failure to do so may result in memory leaks.
The AbortSignal is used to notify observers when the abortController.abort() method is called.
The ArrayBuffer is considered detached if its internal data is null.
The ArrayBuffers for Buffer instances created using Buffer.alloc() or Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow() can always be transferred but doing so renders all other existing views of those ArrayBuffers unusable.

The ArrayBuffers for Buffer instances created using Buffer.alloc() or Buffer.allocUnsafeSlow() can always be transferred but doing so will render all other existing views of those ArrayBuffers unusable.
The AsyncHook instance is disabled by default. If the AsyncHook instance should be enabled immediately after creation, the following pattern can be used.
trans-unit.target: La instancia de AsyncHook está deshabilitada de forma predeterminada. Si la instancia de AsyncHook debe habilitarse inmediatamente después de la creación, se puede usar el siguiente patrón.

trans-unit.source: The BlockList object can be used with some network APIs to specify rules for disabling inbound or outbound access to specific IP addresses, IP ranges, or IP subnets.
The Buffer() function and new Buffer() constructor are deprecated due to API usability issues that can lead to accidental security issues.
trans-unit.target: La función Buffer() y el new Buffer() constructor Buffer () están en desuso debido a problemas de usabilidad de la API que pueden provocar problemas de seguridad accidentales.

trans-unit.source: The Buffer.from() and TypedArray.from() have different signatures and implementations. Specifically, the TypedArray variants accept a second argument that is a mapping function that is invoked on every element of the typed array:
trans-unit.target: El Buffer.from() y TypedArray.from() tienen diferentes firmas e implementaciones. Específicamente, las variantes de TypedArray aceptan un segundo argumento que es una función de mapeo que se invoca en cada elemento de la matriz con tipo:

trans-unit.source: The Buffer.from() method, however, does not support the use of a mapping function:
trans-unit.target: El método Buffer.from() , sin embargo, no admite el uso de una función de mapeo:

trans-unit.source: The Buffer class is a global type for dealing with binary data directly. It can be constructed in a variety of ways.
trans-unit.target: La clase Buffer es un tipo global para tratar directamente con datos binarios. Puede construirse de diversas formas.

trans-unit.source: The Buffer class is a subclass of JavaScript's Uint8Array class and extends it with methods that cover additional use cases. Node.js APIs accept plain Uint8Arrays wherever Buffers are supported as well.
The Buffer class is within the global scope, making it unlikely that one would need to ever use require('buffer').Buffer.
trans-unit.target: La clase Buffer está dentro del alcance global, por lo que es poco probable que uno necesite usar require('buffer').Buffer .

trans-unit.source: The Buffer module pre-allocates an internal Buffer instance of size Buffer.poolSize that is used as a pool for the fast allocation of new Buffer instances created using Buffer.allocUnsafe() and the deprecated new Buffer(size) constructor only when size is less than or equal to Buffer.poolSize >> 1 (floor of Buffer.poolSize divided by two).
trans-unit.target: El módulo Buffer preasigna una instancia interna de Buffer de tamaño Buffer.poolSize que se utiliza como grupo para la asignación rápida de nuevas instancias de Buffer creadas usando Buffer.allocUnsafe() y el new Buffer(size) constructor Buffer (tamaño) obsoleto solo cuando el size es menor que o igual a Buffer.poolSize >> 1 (piso de Buffer.poolSize dividido por dos).

trans-unit.source: The Buffer module pre-allocates an internal Buffer instance of size Buffer.poolSize that is used as a pool for the fast allocation of new Buffer instances created using Buffer.allocUnsafe(), Buffer.from(array), Buffer.concat(), and the deprecated new Buffer(size) constructor only when size is less than or equal to Buffer.poolSize >> 1 (floor of Buffer.poolSize divided by two).
The Buffer object's memory is copied to the TypedArray, not shared.
trans-unit.target: La memoria del objeto Buffer se copia en TypedArray , no se comparte.

trans-unit.source: The Buffer object's memory is interpreted as an array of distinct elements, and not as a byte array of the target type. That is, new Uint32Array(Buffer.from([1, 2, 3, 4])) creates a 4-element Uint32Array with elements [1, 2, 3, 4], not a Uint32Array with a single element [0x1020304] or [0x4030201].
trans-unit.target: La memoria del objeto Buffer se interpreta como una matriz de elementos distintos y no como una matriz de bytes del tipo de destino. Es decir, el new Uint32Array(Buffer.from([1, 2, 3, 4])) crea un Uint32Array de 4 elementos con elementos [1, 2, 3, 4] , no un Uint32Array con un solo elemento [0x1020304] o [0x4030201] .

trans-unit.source: The Buffers class now inherits from Uint8Array.
trans-unit.target: La clase de Buffer ahora hereda de Uint8Array .

trans-unit.source: The CONNECT method is used to allow an HTTP/2 server to be used as a proxy for TCP/IP connections.
trans-unit.target: El método CONNECT se utiliza para permitir que un servidor HTTP / 2 se utilice como proxy para conexiones TCP / IP.

trans-unit.source: The ClientHttp2Stream class is an extension of Http2Stream that is used exclusively on HTTP/2 Clients. Http2Stream instances on the client provide events such as 'response' and 'push' that are only relevant on the client.
trans-unit.target: La clase ClientHttp2Stream es una extensión de Http2Stream que se usa exclusivamente en clientes HTTP / 2. Http2Stream instancias de Http2Stream en el cliente proporcionan eventos como 'response' y 'push' que solo son relevantes para el cliente.

trans-unit.source: The CommonEnvironmentSetup and SpinEventLoop utilities were added.

The Console class can be used to create a simple logger with configurable output streams and can be accessed using either require('console').Console or console.Console (or their destructured counterparts):
trans-unit.target: La clase Console se puede usar para crear un registrador simple con flujos de salida configurables y se puede acceder usando require('console').Console o console.Console (o sus contrapartes desestructuradas):

trans-unit.source: The Console constructor now supports an options argument, and the colorMode option was introduced.
trans-unit.target: El constructor de la Console ahora admite un argumento de options y se introdujo la opción colorMode .

trans-unit.source: The CryptoKeyPair is a simple dictionary object with publicKey and privateKey properties, representing an asymmetric key pair.
The CryptoStream.prototype.readyState property was removed.
trans-unit.target: Se CryptoStream.prototype.readyState propiedad CryptoStream.prototype.readyState .

trans-unit.source: The DiffieHellman class is a utility for creating Diffie-Hellman key exchanges.
trans-unit.target: La clase DiffieHellman es una utilidad para crear intercambios de claves Diffie-Hellman.

trans-unit.source: The DiffieHellmanGroup class takes a well-known modp group as its argument but otherwise works the same as DiffieHellman.
trans-unit.target: La clase DiffieHellmanGroup toma un grupo modp conocido como argumento, pero por lo demás funciona igual que DiffieHellman .

trans-unit.source: The Domain class encapsulates the functionality of routing errors and uncaught exceptions to the active Domain object.
trans-unit.target: La clase de Domain encapsula la funcionalidad de los errores de enrutamiento y las excepciones no detectadas al objeto de Domain activo .

trans-unit.source: The ECDH class is a utility for creating Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman (ECDH) key exchanges.
trans-unit.target: La clase ECDH es una utilidad para crear intercambios de claves de curva elíptica Diffie-Hellman (ECDH).

trans-unit.source: The Error.stackTraceLimit property specifies the number of stack frames collected by a stack trace (whether generated by new Error().stack or Error.captureStackTrace(obj)).
trans-unit.target: La propiedad Error.stackTraceLimit especifica el número de marcos de pila recopilados por un seguimiento de pila (ya sea generado por el new Error().stack o Error.captureStackTrace(obj) ).

trans-unit.source: The Error names and messages are now properly compared
trans-unit.target: Los nombres y mensajes de Error ahora se comparan correctamente

trans-unit.source: The Error names and messages are now properly compared.
The Event class is now available through the global object.
The Event object is an adaptation of the Event Web API. Instances are created internally by Node.js.

The EventEmitter calls all listeners synchronously in the order in which they were registered. This ensures the proper sequencing of events and helps avoid race conditions and logic errors. When appropriate, listener functions can switch to an asynchronous mode of operation using the setImmediate() or process.nextTick() methods:

The EventEmitter calls all listeners synchronously in the order in which they were registered. This is important to ensure the proper sequencing of events and to avoid race conditions or logic errors. When appropriate, listener functions can switch to an asynchronous mode of operation using the setImmediate() or process.nextTick() methods:
trans-unit.target: El EventEmitter llama a todos los oyentes de forma sincrónica en el orden en que fueron registrados. Esto es importante para asegurar la secuencia adecuada de eventos y evitar condiciones de carrera o errores lógicos. Cuando sea apropiado, las funciones de escucha pueden cambiar a un modo de operación asíncrono usando los setImmediate() o process.nextTick() :

trans-unit.source: The EventEmitter class is defined and exposed by the events module:
trans-unit.target: La clase EventEmitter está definida y expuesta por el módulo de events :

trans-unit.source: The EventEmitter instance will emit its own 'newListener' event before a listener is added to its internal array of listeners.
trans-unit.target: La instancia de EventEmitter emitirá su propio evento 'newListener' antes de que se agregue un oyente a su matriz interna de oyentes.

trans-unit.source: The EventTarget and Event classes are now available as globals.

The EventTarget and Event objects are a Node.js-specific implementation of the EventTarget Web API that are exposed by some Node.js core APIs. Neither the EventTarget nor Event classes are available for end user code to create.
The EventTarget class is now available through the global object.
The EventTarget does not implement any special default handling for 'error' type events.
The FileHandle has to support reading.
trans-unit.target: El FileHandle tiene a la lectura de apoyo.

trans-unit.source: The FileHandle has to support writing.
trans-unit.target: El FileHandle tiene que escribir apoyo.

trans-unit.source: The FileHandle must have been opened for appending.
trans-unit.target: El FileHandle debe haberse abierto para agregar.

trans-unit.source: The GLOBAL and root aliases for the global property are deprecated and should no longer be used.
trans-unit.target: Los alias GLOBAL y root de la propiedad global están en desuso y ya no deberían utilizarse.

The Hash class is a utility for creating hash digests of data. It can be used in one of two ways:

trans-unit.source: The MTU is the largest size a given link layer technology can support for datagram messages. For any link, IPv4 mandates a minimum MTU of 68 octets, while the recommended MTU for IPv4 is 576 (typically recommended as the MTU for dial-up type applications), whether they arrive whole or in fragments.
trans-unit.target: La MTU es el tamaño más grande que una tecnología de capa de enlace determinada puede admitir para mensajes de datagramas. Para cualquier enlace, IPv4 exige un MTU mínimo de 68 octetos, mientras que el MTU recomendado para IPv4 es 576 (normalmente recomendado como MTU para aplicaciones de tipo dial-up), ya sea que lleguen enteros o en fragmentos.

trans-unit.source: The MTU is the largest size a given link layer technology can support for datagram messages. For any link, IPv4 mandates a minimum MTU of 68 octets, while the recommended MTU for IPv4 is 576 (typically recommended as the MTU for dial-up type applications), whether they arrive whole or in fragments.

The MessageEvent class. See MessageEvent for more details.

The NODE-DSA algorithm is the common implementation of the DSA digital signature algorithm.

trans-unit.source: The NaN is now compared using the SameValueZero comparison.
trans-unit.target: El NaN ahora se compara usando la comparación SameValueZero .

trans-unit.source: The NodeEventTarget does not emulate the full EventEmitter API. Specifically the prependListener(), prependOnceListener(), rawListeners(), setMaxListeners(), getMaxListeners(), and errorMonitor APIs are not emulated. The 'newListener' and 'removeListener' events will also not be emitted.
The NodeEventTarget does not implement any special default behavior for events with type 'error'.
The NodeEventTarget is a Node.js-specific extension to EventTarget that emulates a subset of the EventEmitter API.

The NodeEventTarget object implements a modified subset of the EventEmitter API that allows it to closely emulate an EventEmitter in certain situations. A NodeEventTarget is not an instance of EventEmitter and cannot be used in place of an EventEmitter in most cases.
The NodeEventTarget supports EventListener objects as well as functions as handlers for all event types.

trans-unit.source: The OutgoingMessage.prototype._renderHeaders property was never documented as an officially supported API.

trans-unit.source: The PADDING_STRATEGY_CALLBACK has been made equivalent to providing PADDING_STRATEGY_ALIGNED and selectPadding has been removed.

The Payload Length field is 16 bits wide, which means that a normal payload cannot exceed 64K octets including the internet header and data (65,507 bytes = 65,535 − 8 bytes UDP header − 20 bytes IP header); this is generally true for loopback interfaces, but such long datagram messages are impractical for most hosts and networks.

The Payload Length field is 16 bits wide, which means that a normal payload exceed 64K octets including the internet header and data (65,507 bytes = 65,535 − 8 bytes UDP header − 20 bytes IP header); this is generally true for loopback interfaces, but such long datagram messages are impractical for most hosts and networks.
trans-unit.target: El campo Payload Length tiene 16 bits de ancho, lo que significa que una carga útil normal excede los 64K octetos, incluido el encabezado y los datos de Internet (65.507 bytes = 65.535 - encabezado UDP de 8 bytes - encabezado IP de 20 bytes); esto es generalmente cierto para las interfaces loopback, pero los mensajes de datagramas tan largos no son prácticos para la mayoría de los hosts y redes.

The Promise cannot be canceled. Once quicendpoint.close() is called, the QuicEndpoint will be destroyed.
The Promise is not necessarily fulfilled or rejected at this point if the Promise was resolved by assuming the state of another Promise.
trans-unit.target: La Promise no se cumple o rechaza necesariamente en este punto si la Promise se resolvió asumiendo el estado de otra Promise .

trans-unit.source: The Promise is resolved with an object containing a bytesRead property identifying the number of bytes read, and a buffers property containing a reference to the buffers input.
The Promise is resolved with an object containing a bytesWritten property identifying the number of bytes written, and a buffer property containing a reference to the buffer written.
trans-unit.target: La Promise se resuelve con un objeto que contiene una propiedad bytesWritten que identifica el número de bytes escritos y una propiedad de buffer contiene una referencia al buffer escrito.

trans-unit.source: The Promise is resolved with an object containing a bytesWritten property identifying the number of bytes written, and a buffer property containing a reference to the string written.
trans-unit.target: La Promise se resuelve con un objeto que contiene una propiedad bytesWritten que identifica el número de bytes escritos y una propiedad de buffer contiene una referencia a la string escrita.

trans-unit.source: The Promise is resolved with an object containing a bytesWritten property identifying the number of bytes written, and a buffers property containing a reference to the buffers input.
trans-unit.target: La Promise se resuelve con un objeto que contiene una propiedad bytesWritten que identifica el número de bytes escritos y una propiedad de buffers contiene una referencia a la entrada de buffers .

trans-unit.source: The Promise is resolved with the fs.Stats object for the given path.
trans-unit.target: La Promise se resuelve con el objeto fs.Stats para la path dada .

trans-unit.source: The Promise is resolved with the contents of the file. If no encoding is specified (using options.encoding), the data is returned as a Buffer object. Otherwise, the data will be a string.
trans-unit.target: La Promise se resuelve con el contenido del archivo. Si no se especifica ninguna codificación (usando options.encoding ), los datos se devuelven como un objeto Buffer . De lo contrario, los datos serán una cadena.

trans-unit.source: The Promise will be rejected if the QuicSession has been destroyed, is in the process of a graceful shutdown, or the QuicSession is otherwise blocked from opening a new stream.
The QuicClientSession class implements the client side of a QUIC connection. Instances are created using the quicsocket.connect() method.
The QuicEndpoint wraps a local UDP binding used by a QuicSocket to send and receive data. A single QuicSocket may be bound to multiple QuicEndpoint instances at any given time.
The QuicServerSession class implements the server side of a QUIC connection. Instances are created internally and are emitted using the QuicSocket'session' event.
The QuicServerSession or QuicClientSession to which the QuicStream belongs.
The QuicSession instance will have been destroyed by the time the 'sessionError' event is emitted.
The QuicSession is an abstract base class that defines events, methods, and properties that are shared by both QuicClientSession and QuicServerSession.
The QuicSocket the QuicSession is associated with.

trans-unit.source: The Readable stream API evolved across multiple Node.js versions and provides multiple methods of consuming stream data. In general, developers should choose one of the methods of consuming data and should never use multiple methods to consume data from a single stream. Specifically, using a combination of on('data'), on('readable'), pipe(), or async iterators could lead to unintuitive behavior.
trans-unit.target: La Readable API corriente evolucionó a través de múltiples versiones Node.js y proporciona múltiples métodos de consumir datos de la secuencia. En general, los desarrolladores deben elegir uno de los métodos para consumir datos y nunca deben usar varios métodos para consumir datos de un solo flujo. Específicamente, el uso de una combinación de iteradores on('data') , on('readable') , pipe() o async podría conducir a un comportamiento poco intuitivo.

trans-unit.source: The Readable stream will properly handle multi-byte characters delivered through the stream that would otherwise become improperly decoded if simply pulled from the stream as Buffer objects.
trans-unit.target: El flujo Readable manejará correctamente los caracteres multibyte entregados a través del flujo que, de otro modo, se decodificarían incorrectamente si simplemente se extraen del flujo como objetos de Buffer .

Http2Stream instancias de Http2Stream en el servidor proporcionan métodos adicionales como http2stream.pushStream() y http2stream.respond() que solo son relevantes en el servidor.

trans-unit.source: The Symbol.for('nodejs.rejection') method is called in case a promise rejection happens when emitting an event and captureRejections is enabled on the emitter. It is possible to use events.captureRejectionSymbol in place of Symbol.for('nodejs.rejection').

The TCPSERVERWRAP is not part of this graph, even though it was the reason for console.log() being called. This is because binding to a port without a host name is a synchronous operation, but to maintain a completely asynchronous API the user's callback is placed in a process.nextTick(). Which is why TickObject is present in the output and is a 'parent' for .listen() callback.

The TCPSERVERWRAP is not part of this graph, even though it was the reason for console.log() being called. This is because binding to a port without a hostname is a synchronous operation, but to maintain a completely asynchronous API the user's callback is placed in a process.nextTick().
trans-unit.target: El TCPSERVERWRAP no es parte de este gráfico, a pesar de que era la razón de console.log() se llama. Esto se debe a que la vinculación a un puerto sin un nombre de host es una operación sincrónica , pero para mantener una API completamente asincrónica, la devolución de llamada del usuario se coloca en un process.nextTick() .

trans-unit.source: The TCPSERVERWRAP is the server which receives the connections.
trans-unit.target: El TCPSERVERWRAP es el servidor que recibe las conexiones.

trans-unit.source: The TCPWRAP is the new connection from the client. When a new connection is made, the TCPWrap instance is immediately constructed. This happens outside of any JavaScript stack. (An executionAsyncId() of 0 means that it is being executed from C++ with no JavaScript stack above it.) With only that information, it would be impossible to link resources together in terms of what caused them to be created, so triggerAsyncId is given the task of propagating what resource is responsible for the new resource's existence.
trans-unit.target: El TCPWRAP es la nueva conexión desde el cliente. Cuando se establece una nueva conexión, la instancia de TCPWrap se construye inmediatamente. Esto sucede fuera de cualquier pila de JavaScript. (Un executionAsyncId() de 0 significa que se está ejecutando desde C ++ sin una pila de JavaScript encima). Con solo esa información, sería imposible vincular los recursos en términos de lo que causó su creación, por triggerAsyncId se proporciona triggerAsyncId la tarea de propagar qué recurso es responsable de la existencia del nuevo recurso.

trans-unit.source: The _construct() method MUST NOT be called directly. It may be implemented by child classes, and if so, will be called by the internal Readable class methods only.
The _construct() method MUST NOT be called directly. It may be implemented by child classes, and if so, will be called by the internal Writable class methods only.

trans-unit.source: The address argument is a string. If the value of address is a host name, DNS will be used to resolve the address of the host. If address is not provided or otherwise falsy, '127.0.0.1' (for udp4 sockets) or '::1' (for udp6 sockets) will be used by default.
trans-unit.target: El argumento de la address es una cadena. Si el valor de la address es un nombre de host, se utilizará DNS para resolver la dirección del host. Si la address no se proporciona o es falsa, se usará '127.0.0.1' (para sockets udp4 ) o '::1' (para sockets udp6 ) por defecto.

trans-unit.source: The address parameter is always optional now.
trans-unit.target: El parámetro de address siempre es opcional ahora.

trans-unit.source: The addressType is one of:
trans-unit.target: El addressType es uno de los siguientes:

trans-unit.source: The algorithm is dependent on OpenSSL, examples are 'aes192', etc. On recent OpenSSL releases, openssl list -cipher-algorithms (openssl list-cipher-algorithms for older versions of OpenSSL) will display the available cipher algorithms.
trans-unit.target: El algorithm depende de OpenSSL, los ejemplos son 'aes192' , etc. En las versiones recientes de OpenSSL, openssl list -cipher-algorithms ( openssl list-cipher-algorithms para versiones anteriores de OpenSSL) mostrará los algoritmos de cifrado disponibles.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm is dependent on the available algorithms supported by the version of OpenSSL on the platform. Examples are 'sha256', 'sha512', etc. On recent releases of OpenSSL, openssl list -digest-algorithms (openssl list-message-digest-algorithms for older versions of OpenSSL) will display the available digest algorithms.
trans-unit.target: El algorithm depende de los algoritmos disponibles compatibles con la versión de OpenSSL en la plataforma. Algunos ejemplos son 'sha256' , 'sha512' , etc. En versiones recientes de OpenSSL, openssl list -digest-algorithms ( openssl list-message-digest-algorithms para versiones anteriores de OpenSSL) mostrará los algoritmos de resumen disponibles.

trans-unit.source: The async_hooks module provides an API to register callbacks tracking the lifetime of asynchronous resources created inside a Node.js application. It can be accessed using:
trans-unit.target: El módulo async_hooks proporciona una API para registrar devoluciones de llamada que realizan un seguimiento de la vida útil de los recursos asincrónicos creados dentro de una aplicación Node.js. Se puede acceder mediante:

trans-unit.source: The async_hooks module provides an API to track asynchronous resources. It can be accessed using:

The async_resource object needs to be kept alive until napi_async_destroy to keep async_hooks related API acts correctly. In order to retain ABI compatibility with previous versions, napi_async_contexts are not maintaining the strong reference to the async_resource objects to avoid introducing causing memory leaks. However, if the async_resource is garbage collected by JavaScript engine before the napi_async_context was destroyed by napi_async_destroy, calling napi_async_context related APIs like napi_open_callback_scope and napi_make_callback can cause problems like loss of async context when using the AsyncLocalStoage API.

The async_resource_name identifier is provided by the user and should be representative of the type of async work being performed. It is also recommended to apply namespacing to the identifier, e.g. by including the module name. See the async_hooks documentation for more information.
trans-unit.target: El async_resource_name proporciona el identificador async_resource_name y debe ser representativo del tipo de trabajo asincrónico que se está realizando. También se recomienda aplicar espacios de nombres al identificador, por ejemplo, incluyendo el nombre del módulo. Consulte la documentación de async_hooks para obtener más información.

trans-unit.source: The atime and mtime arguments follow these rules:
trans-unit.target: Los argumentos atime y mtime siguen estas reglas:

trans-unit.source: The atimeMs, mtimeMs, ctimeMs, birthtimeMs properties are numbers that hold the corresponding times in milliseconds. Their precision is platform specific. atime, mtime, ctime, and birthtime are Date object alternate representations of the various times. The Date and number values are not connected. Assigning a new number value, or mutating the Date value, will not be reflected in the corresponding alternate representation.
trans-unit.target: Las atimeMs , mtimeMs , ctimeMs , birthtimeMs son números que contienen los tiempos correspondientes en milisegundos. Su precisión es específica de la plataforma. atime , mtime , ctime , y birthtime son Date objeto representaciones alternativas de los diversos momentos. Los valores de Date y número no están conectados. La asignación de un nuevo valor numérico o la mutación del valor de Date no se reflejará en la representación alternativa correspondiente.

trans-unit.source: The atimeMs, mtimeMs, ctimeMs, birthtimeMs properties are numeric values that hold the corresponding times in milliseconds. Their precision is platform specific. When bigint: true is passed into the method that generates the object, the properties will be bigints, otherwise they will be numbers.

The atimeNs, mtimeNs, ctimeNs, birthtimeNs properties are bigints that hold the corresponding times in nanoseconds. They are only present when bigint: true is passed into the method that generates the object. Their precision is platform specific.

trans-unit.source: The auth fields is cleared now the to parameter contains a hostname.
trans-unit.target: Los campos de auth se borran ahora que el parámetro to contiene un nombre de host.

trans-unit.source: The auth property is the username and password portion of the URL, also referred to as userinfo. This string subset follows the protocol and double slashes (if present) and precedes the host component, delimited by @. The string is either the username, or it is the username and password separated by :.
trans-unit.target: La propiedad de auth es la parte del nombre de usuario y la contraseña de la URL, también denominada información de usuario . Este subconjunto de cadenas sigue el protocol o y barras dobles (si están presentes) y precede al componente de host , delimitado por @ . La cadena es o bien el nombre de usuario, o que es el nombre de usuario y contraseña separados por : .

trans-unit.source: The authTagLength option can now be used to produce shorter authentication tags in GCM mode and defaults to 16 bytes.
trans-unit.target: La opción authTagLength ahora se puede utilizar para producir etiquetas de autenticación más cortas en el modo GCM y su valor predeterminado es 16 bytes.

trans-unit.source: The authTagLength option can now be used to restrict accepted GCM authentication tag lengths.
trans-unit.target: La opción authTagLength ahora se puede utilizar para restringir las longitudes de las etiquetas de autenticación GCM aceptadas.

trans-unit.source: The autoClose option is supported now.
trans-unit.target: La opción autoClose es compatible ahora.

trans-unit.source: The await keyword may be used in the top level (outside of async functions) within modules as per the ECMAScript Top-Level await proposal.

The before callback will be called 0 to N times. The before callback will typically be called 0 times if the asynchronous operation was cancelled or, for example, if no connections are received by a TCP server. Persistent asynchronous resources like a TCP server will typically call the before callback multiple times, while other operations like fs.open() will call it only once.
trans-unit.target: La devolución de llamada before se llamará de 0 a N veces. La devolución de llamada before normalmente se llamará 0 veces si se canceló la operación asincrónica o, por ejemplo, si un servidor TCP no recibe conexiones. Los recursos asíncronos persistentes como un servidor TCP normalmente llamarán a la devolución de llamada before varias veces, mientras que otras operaciones como fs.open() lo llamarán solo una vez.

trans-unit.source: The bigint option is now supported.
The bigint version of the process.hrtime() method returning the current high-resolution real time in a bigint.
trans-unit.target: La versión bigint del método process.hrtime() que devuelve el tiempo real de alta resolución actual en un bigint .

trans-unit.source: The bigint version of the process.hrtime() method returning the current high-resolution real time in nanoseconds as a bigint.
The breakEvalOnSigint option is supported now.
The breakLength option is supported now.
trans-unit.target: La opción breakLength ahora es compatible.

trans-unit.source: The breakOnSigint option is supported now.
trans-unit.target: La opción breakOnSigint ahora es compatible.

trans-unit.source: The buf.parent property is a deprecated alias for buf.buffer.
trans-unit.target: La propiedad buf.parent es un alias obsoleto para buf.buffer .
